properties.name: Ashmore House
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds11 Talbot Rd, Sunderland, UKFlat since 2002, not yet built in this map image

properties.name: Brian's current house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Brian and Brenda live now.

properties.name: Brian's old house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Brian lived as a lad.

properties.name: Bus stop
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere we got the No. 18 bus to the old Monkey House.

properties.name: Bus stop
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsI could get here for the 12.04 bus allowing me to get back to Talbot Rd for lunch. Class came out at 12.00. Often a muddy sprint. Most others had to take the 12.15 bus.

properties.name: Cannon Ball Rocks
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds11 Talbot Rd, Sunderland, UKConcretions of mangesian limestone in the shape and size of cannon balls. Where my family would set up our deckchairs on the sand when I was just a lad.

properties.name: Cat and Dog Steps
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds11 Talbot Rd, Sunderland, UKThe way down to the beach at Roker where I mispent my summers on the promenade with the rest of my boy and girl friends - teenage dramas played out here.

properties.name: Cemetry gates
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsMid point on walk to school which proceeded through the cemetary, also a place to linger after school before friends dispersed.

properties.name: Cricket Field
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsSite of Masters v. Boys annual cricket match at end of year.

properties.name: Cross Country course
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsThe Monkey House cross country course went from school, across the park, up Carley Hill, round the Quarry to Newcastle Rd. then back along Thompson Rd., across the park back to school.

properties.name: Cross Country course (back)
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsLast mile along the stream to the back of the school.

properties.name: Cross Country course (out)
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsUp Dene Lane, round all the fields towards Whitburn then back along the stream (see other place tag)

properties.name: Darien Avenue
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere my Auntie Mary, Uncle Tom, Grandma and cousins Mavis and Audrey lived (#30). Also where my Uncle Jim and Auntie Sadie lived (#20).

properties.name: Fulwell Infant School
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds No longer there, but where infant school years were spent.

properties.name: Fulwell Junior School
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds Where junior school years were spent.

properties.name: Grass track field
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsHad a track marked on it in Spring, and where I trained hard for the track season.

properties.name: John's current house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere John T. lives now.

properties.name: John's old house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere John T. lived as a lad.

properties.name: June's house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere June lived as a lass.

properties.name: Ken's current house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Ken and Fiona live now.

properties.name: Ken's old house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Ken lived as a lad. A stopping point on the walk home from school.

properties.name: Margaret's old house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Margaret lived as a lass.

properties.name: Mike's old house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Mike my training partner lived.

properties.name: Monkwearmouth Comprehensive School
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds Where we moved for 5th and 6th form, a brand new school then. The current Monkey House.

properties.name: Monkwearmouth Grammar School (Old)
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds The original Monkey House, where I spent First to Fourth year, before moving to the new school in Seaburn. The buildings crossing the quad where assembly hall and gym.

properties.name: Natal Clinic
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds11 Talbot Rd, Sunderland, UKWhere I was born, a private clinic in 1947, now a home.

properties.name: Norman's old house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Norman lived as a lad.

properties.name: Park bridge
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds a.k.a as the spitting bridge.

properties.name: Peter's old house
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere Peter used to live.

properties.name: Roker Beach
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds  Where we played football any Sat. a.m., just join the game. Sweaters for goal posts. If high tide, then up onto the cliff top.

properties.name: Roker Congregational Church
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsWhere I attended church and was a S.S. teacher. Former site, now houses.

properties.name: Roker Park
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds Classic English Park, including lawn bowls, tennis courts, lake for toy boats, playgrounds, miniature train, ice cream man.

properties.name: Roker Park
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsThe site of the former SAFC stadium, Roker Park. Many a Saturday afternoon, 3 p.m. kick off and Wed. night under the floodlights spent here. Many a ghost here now. RIP

properties.name: Sea Road
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsTagged where Trembath\'s fish and chip shop used to be, a Sat. noon tradition, up on my bike to get the lots, before the afternoon game at Roker Park.

properties.name: Seaburn Camp
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsA running track was marked out here every season, and I often trained on it.

properties.name: Talbot Rd
properties.description: Posted by Allandodds11 Talbot Rd, Sunderland, UKOur house from 1945 to 2002. Still "ours" when this picture was taken, note the shed, now gone, and the tidy back garden, now gone (need full zoom)

properties.name: The Bank
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsOne place where I trained both winter and summer, up this hill then down Sea Lane/Princess/Dykeland back to the bottom. Repeat 10 times. Also daily walk/bike to school.

properties.name: The Black Cats
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsThe gunnery emplacement where the big gun, The Black Cat, once stood and the SAFC footballers once practiced on the sand below. The club nickname comes from this?

properties.name: The Cut
properties.description: Posted by AllandoddsA short cut to Ken\'s house.
